title: apcore ACL Configuration Schema
description: JSON Schema for validating ACL YAML configuration files. Based on PROTOCOL_SPEC Section 6.

default_effect.description: Default effect when no rule matches a caller/target pair. MUST be 'allow' or 'deny'. Defaults to 'deny' for security.

rules.description: Ordered list of ACL rules. Rules are evaluated by priority (higher first), then by definition order. For same priority, deny takes precedence over allow.

ACLRule.description: A single ACL rule that matches callers against targets and applies an effect.

id.description: Optional unique identifier for this rule, used for logging and debugging.

callers.description: List of caller module ID patterns. Supports wildcards: '*' matches any characters. Special values: '@external' for top-level/external calls, '@system' for internal system calls.

targets.description: List of target module ID patterns. Supports wildcards: '*' matches any characters.

actions.description: List of actions this rule applies to. If omitted, defaults to ['*'] (all actions).

effect.description: The effect to apply when this rule matches. 'allow' permits the call, 'deny' rejects it.

priority.description: Rule priority. Higher numbers mean higher priority (evaluated first). At the same priority level, deny takes precedence over allow.

description.description: Human-readable description of the rule's purpose.

RuleConditions.description: Additional conditions for rule matching (beyond caller/target patterns).

identity_types.description: Only match when the caller's identity type is one of these values.

identity_roles.description: Only match when the caller has at least one of these roles.

time_window.description: Only match during specific time windows.

max_call_depth.description: Only match when call chain depth does not exceed this value.

enabled.description: Whether to enable ACL audit logging.

include_denied.description: Whether to log denied access attempts.
